ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to work in lab and create and modify experiments to gain insight into what I am studying. How to analyze data appropriately. How to organize data.
I learned how to make short-term and long-term plans for a research project, how to write a formal report, and how to present about my work.
I learned how to best articulate, present, and write on the research that I have been conducting this semester on a novel DNA interstrand crosslinking agent.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Experience depends on lab, lots of freedom to work on project and flexible schedule. Despite low engagement with instructor, lack of feedback, little opportunity for support outside of lab members, the course is a great opportunity to continue research while getting credit.
Course didnt meet a single time in person or have any group activities: perhaps adding that in as well as more support during the writing process, would be helpful

Strengths: you just work with you're PI and lab
Weaknesses: no real guidance, there's no communication between the course instructor and the students

Strengths: There is a lot of flexibility in which topics you can conduct research on. Dr. Schilling is also very responsive to emails, willing to help, and understanding if your research doesn't go as planned. Weaknesses: None.
This course allowed me the freedom to research what I found interesting, and I was able to conduct whatever steps were needed in this pursuit.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Best opportunity to grow as an independent researcher and avoid other lab courses
Yes, great way to get credit for research that you would be doing anyways throughout the semester. Also good for honing your writing/presentation skills

Yes! This course allows you to conduct research while earning course credit. Furthermore, the assignments hold you accountable, help you stay on track, and teach you how to write and present about your findings.
I would recommend this course to any student who wishes to deeply devote themselves to studying a subject matter in biochemistry they find personally inspiring.
